abstracts.cdata!:
The project has succeeded in
            strengthening the Kyrgyz Agricultural Finance Corporation
            (KAFC,) which is now the primary agricultural lender,
            accounting for 90 percent of all agricultural lending.
            Project rating are as follows : project outcome is
            satisfactory; sustainability is likely; institutional
            development impact is substantial; Bank performance and
            Borrower is satisfactory. The report cites the following
            lessons learned : 1)creation of a " greenfield "
            financial intermediary takes a long time and requires
            significant concerted efforts from the donors and owners and
            staff of the financial intermediary; 2) Judicious
            combination of Technical Assistance and funding works very
            effectively in credit-line based institution development; 3)
            effective motivation of staff is very important; 4) an
            effective dialogue with the Government is a key to ensure
            that the Government does not interfere in day-to-day
            operations of state-owned financial institutions; 5)
            privatization of a successful institution requires timely
            and effective communication of the exit strategy; and 6)
            availability of client development services is a key to
            improving access of rural entrepreneurs to financial services.
